sources.data_found: BigJay cluster: mix of CPU, high-memory CPU, and GPU-enabled processors; came online August 2022 and October 2022; 83% GPU usage; MRI funded resource accounts for approximately 42% of the total high-performance computing capacity at KU
KU Community Cluster: condo model cluster; Standard Compute Unit (SCU) defined as Dual Intel Xeon 6442Y CPU (Total 48 cores @ 2.6GHz)

EECS Department: 75% of EECS Graduate Students Receive Funding from Assistantships or Fellowships; offers Ph.D. degrees in electrical engineering and computer science; and M.S. degrees in electrical engineering, computer engineering, and computer science
University of Kansas total enrollment: 28,406 students including 20,696 undergraduate students and 7,710 graduate students (2023-2024)
In 2023, 7,809 degrees were awarded across all undergraduate and graduate programs; Most common positions for non-instructional staff include Computer, Engineering, and Science with 515 employees

student_data.notes: Exact CS enrollment figures not publicly available. Estimates based on: (1) Total university enrollment of 28,406 with 20,696 undergrads and 7,710 grad students; (2) EECS is one of 11 major academic departments using BigJay cluster per NSF grant; (3) 75% of EECS graduate students receive funding support; (4) Typical CS department represents 3-5% of total university enrollment at large research universities. Used conservative 4% estimate for undergrads (800) and higher proportion for graduate programs given EECS research focus.

gpu_resources.notes: BigJay cluster funded by NSF MRI Award #2117449 includes GPU-enabled processors, with 83% GPU usage reported. However, specific GPU models and counts are not publicly documented. The cluster represents 42% of KU's total HPC capacity. KU Community Cluster uses condo model where researchers purchase nodes, but detailed GPU specifications not found in public documentation.

analysis_notes: Limited public documentation available for University of Kansas HPC resources. While the NSF-funded BigJay cluster is confirmed to have GPU resources with high utilization (83%), specific GPU models and quantities are not publicly disclosed. Student enrollment data estimated from university-wide statistics as department-specific CS enrollment not publicly available.
